Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Position”
Reviews.Author: Peter E
Reviews.Content: Great position and excellent value. Breakfast good. Excellent facilities in the room. Only negative the aircon didnt work and we couldnt sleep with the windows open because of the street noise so was a bit stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Aleksandra1107
Reviews.Content: I can recommmend it to everyone! Warm, clean, charming, modern and romantic...Very friendly ladies at reception desk who you cant call just a service. I will miss Venice and the atmosphere of the hotel.If I ever go to Venice I would choose Albergo Firenze once again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: James_4_1979
Reviews.Content: After an hour long boat ride from Venice Airport in freezing weather the hotel was extremely warm and welcoming. It had a lovely cosy element in the reception room where we were introduced to Bruno who works at the desk and is a true gentleman and an absolute delight to talk to if you ever get the privilege to meet him. Because the hotel has no carpets you do hear footsteps from other guests movements in their rooms or along the corridors, but this wasn't a major issue. The bathroom was small but extremely clean and well maintained on a daily basis. Our room was tastefully decorated in Venitian decor, but there was no tea making facilities. Breakfast consisted of breads, cold meats, cheese, cereals, fruit and hot bevereages. It's not possible to have a cooked breakfast, but we were snacking on local produce on our daily tours around Venice so we didn't let that become an issue. The hotel is situated extremely close to St. Marks Square but you don't hear any of the hustle and bustle from crowds outside, but the bell ringing from the nearby Basillica was a wonderfully unique touch to our first visit to Venice. We will definately consider this hotel again in our future holiday plans.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe the location for the price: GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: Kym-Anh
Reviews.Content: I've been to Venice numerous times, and this was the BEST location for its affordable price. Proximity to St. Mark's Square was OUTSTANDING. The vaporetto stop is only one block away. The bathroom was super clean, and our breakfast was ample. You won't go hungry at breakfast here. I believe that the dear older gentleman working this night desk's name is Bruno (?), and he was so helpful! He was born & raised in Venice and asked us if we wanted dinner recommendations. (On a previous trip to Venice, the restaurant recommended to us was pricey--though delicious). We took Bruno up on his offer, and let me tell you, you can't go wrong. Given the hordes of pricey tourist trap restaurants with poor quality, its often hard to find a really good meal for the value. Well, Bruno made reservations for us on 2 nights at 2 different restaurants in his neighborhood (where he lives, not works). It was a quieter, less touristy area. Neither restaurant was crowded but both were excellent...and inexpensive!! (I'll look for my notes on the restaurants later, but both places were waiting for us when we arrived and offered exceptional service, quality of food, and wonderful prices). It was great that we were off the beaten path. The second restaurant even made their own pastas, and the "homemade pasta" menu changes daily. I'd stay at Albergo Firenze again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia M
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from staying in this great hotel. Lovely staff, excellent position, great room & great breakfast. Will definitely return. Having stayed at similar priced hotels in Rome & Florence, this was luxury compared to them. So clean!! and breakfast was ideal. We stayed in a quad room and it was fine. My 3 teenage sons thought the breakfast was great. So close to everything and once you work out where it is, quite easy to find! Thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in town???”
Reviews.Author: Ollyolly
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Hotel Firenze for three nights at the start of December 2011. The room was quite, warm, cosy and clean. But, most importantly, it's right in the middle of the action in San Marco, only a few paces from St Mark's Square. Breakfast wasn't amazing, but heah, it's all thrown in at a reasonable rate. Also, the staff spoke excellent English, though that's probably pretty common in Venice. It's not a five-star hotel, but for a budget, this place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Donna M
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel in the heart of Venice right in the San Marcos area. Having never been to Venice before we soon learned how centrally located we were. The hotel was clean, quiet and well managed. The continental breakfast was great and you can get cappuccino if you ask for it, which we did. There is a lovely rooftop terrace, but in November it was a little chilly to sit outside. The price was fair, 180 euro for 2 nights. If we ever return to Venice we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, top-quality, excellent value-for-money hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: matthewradford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Firenze for 3 nights in November 2011 - 70 euros per night. The room was very comfortable and quite spacious, and the bathroom was heavenly! The breakfast was also excellent a variety of cereals, croissants, meats, bread, fruit, etc. Perhaps most importantly, the staff was helpful, polite and friendly. I will gladly recommend the Firenze Hotel to any of my friends who intend travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Rita K
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed this hotel. It is easy to find and right by the train station which means you don't have to go shlepping all over Venice on vaparettos to get to your lodging. The staff was extremely helpful and bent over backwards to make our stay great. The room was nice and clean and pleasant. The lounge area is lovely and the dining area is huge. Very nice breakfast, too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Doors closed...”
Reviews.Author: mariajoaquina
Reviews.Content: I booked (and pre-paid) this Hotel with 4 months in advance. I was looking forward to my stay in Venice. However, when I arrived at the hotel, I was surprised with a note at the door saying "CLOSED FOR VACATION"!!! Suddenly a man came out of the hotel and told me that it was true, the Hotel was closed (!!!??). He directed me to another hotel. Although I pre-paid my stay and was in contact with the hotel by email, no one cared to inform me that the Hotel would be closed. I found the doors closed to me and felt like crying.... This shows that this Hotel does not care for its guests and I would NEVER recommend it to other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseDuck2142
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to San Marco and the hotel staff are very helpful. Excellent continental breakfat in the morning. It is quite hard to find as the only sign is the doormat at the entrance to the courtyard. We walked right past the hotel on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine E
Reviews.Content: Although small and not much room for luggage, hotel was clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, cramped, and disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: effthishotel
Reviews.Content: My dad and I are currently staying here. We are both absolutely miserable. Sure, Italy's hotels are known for having small rooms, but this room literally has not even enough space to walk without thinking out how you're going to maneuver yourself over to the door. We spent $270 on a room with two twin beds and the beds are placed directly next to each other and my father snores like a freight train so I will continue to get no sleep until we get out of here. Also, we found a half-eaten apple under the bed that looks like its at least a year old and the mini-bar looks like something out of a horror movie. I don't understand how this hotel got so many positive reviews when its rooms are this bad. Oh and their wifi doesn't work anymore. Someone shoot me. My father and I both travel A LOT and neither one of us have been more disappointed with a hotel in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “I really recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wichserastrid
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, only some meters from San Marco, quiet location, points of interest easily accessible by foot, friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Mikebcq
Reviews.Content: Well maintained and most comfortable. Central location. Friendly staff. Hire a water-taxi from and to the airport

Reviews.Title: “a neat little hotel close to 'everything.'”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLady9
Reviews.Content: Hotel Firenze is a few minutes walk from the Water Bus--and easy to find among the designer shops and antiques and restaurants and hotels. You enter through a little courtyard close to Piazza San Marco and there it is quiet and special. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean and quiet.the staff are friendly, helpful alnd thoughtful. Breakfast is served in a pleasant room It is a lovely little respite.

Reviews.Title: “Not easy to find - but worth the effort!”
Reviews.Author: Kule Dude
Reviews.Content: Had arranged the visit for my wife's Birthday - thus it had to be mid November. But weather was very good - cool but dry with some sunshine. Booked the hotel through a booking agency - which was much cheaper than prices advertised on the hotel's website. As reported by other travellers, rooms & bathrooms were small, but very clean and well fitted. Bathrooms managed to fit wc, bath, bidet, shower, basin, radio & telephone in a small space! Breakfast was very good: juices/fruit salad (fresh)/breads/cheese/meats/yoghurt/coffee/tea etc. Reception staff friendly & helpful, although we did not take up their recommendations for restaurants after reading other reviews. We did however find a good restaurant by chance (www.tavernasantrovaso.it) - which we later found to have many good reviews on Trip Advisor. Good food and atmosphere at a reasonable (for Venice!) price. Location of the hotel is ideal - less that 80 yards to Piazza San Marco - and not much further to a vaporetto stage. As a general comment - budget an amount of money to take to Venice for your holiday - then double it - and you shouldn't have to try to find too many cash machines for the second half your stay. Prices for eating and drinking were VERY high and the prices for clothes and shoes....must stop, blood pressure rising too high.... Would certainly recommend this hotel to others - and Venice is a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Gottschlich
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not spacious but nice and clean. Hotel is perfectly located with just a 3 min walk to St. Marks' Place. Wonderful roof terrace which is ideal for a breakfast when nice weather (breakfast will be carried from breakfast room to roof terrace for small extra fee) Negative was that the hotel mismanaged our first (out of two) nights and we were asked to stay at a partner hotel nearby (Hotel Casanova). The latter was not bad but at a lower category than Hotel Firenze (which rates we were charged however)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sangreer
Reviews.Content: Due to some guests not arriving we were upgraded to a room with a balcony - not sure what the other rooms were like, I've marked based on ours which was pretty, cosy and quiet. They also have a lovely roof terrace with views of the city. Not wheelchair/ mobility friendly, the lift only goes up to the 3 floor (4 floors). It's right in the heart of San Marco, the staff were friendly and there were some tasty homemade cakes at breakfast. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJSF10
Reviews.Content: Just been away for a few days break and were pleasantly surprised by this hotel and it's great location near the San Marco square. As the last review stated it was perfectly located near the San Marco Boat stop which was particularly helpful! We had a great room on the top floor with a lovely balcony. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand the good ratings of this 'hotel'”
Reviews.Author: no_ol
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for four days, the three first nights at the Hotel Santa Marina, and the last night in the Hotel Firenze. Although greatly located at 2 minutes from St Marco (which is the reason why it is so expensive), it is noisy as hell (the windows don't keep the street noise down, and you can hear the conversations from the nearby rooms, word to word). The receptionnist seems nice at the arrival : you believe him to be a true Venetian, loving his city, and wanting to share all the things he likes in the city. So when he recommends a restaurant, by being held by a family, you go there thinking of it as being the true venetian restaurant, not the typical tourist restaurant. We went there, and it was as far as possible from what we thought it would be : a noisy restaurant, with techno music, televisions everywhere, ... On the good part, it is not expensive. But when the waiter asks you who recommended you from the hotel, you understand that the "truly venetian hotel receptionnist" is tipped for your choice of restaurant. So I would not recommend this hotel. On the other hand, I would recommend the far better Hotel Santa Marina, which is really cheaper (the nights were 100 EUR per night, compared to 160 EUR for the Firenze), and in a very calm neighbourhood, with almost no tourists. It is located at approx. 5 minutes from Rialto, and ten minutes from San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: arkaykolkata
Reviews.Content: A stone's throw from Piazza San Marco. A clean hotel albeit small rooms. Found it comfortable with a very central location

Reviews.Title: “Super location, friendly staff. You pay for what you get near San Marco!”
Reviews.Author: nosaint1
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel. Would have been difficult to find had my 9 year old son not walked with his head down. (There is a "Hotel Firenze" marquis on the ground.) Staff was friendly. Our family stayed in two triple rooms: 2 grandparents, 2 children (boys, ages 7 and 9) and their parents. Excellent location. The breakfast room was small and crowded, but hotel was clean, comfortable and friendly. AND, it was a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: FashionistaSweden
Reviews.Content: The only complain I have is that it was difficult to find, no sign outside or so and the entrance was in between other buildings. But the location is fantastic, just off San Marco. The rooms were very nice and the view from the roof was amazing! I wish I had stayed there in the summer so that we could have had our breakfast up there. But it was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous position”
Reviews.Author: sydalg
Reviews.Content: central but quiet at nights ,easy walking to all attractions and vaparettos ,staff ex .friendly .good breakfasts

Reviews.Title: “Venice's hidden secret”
Reviews.Author: Emms-owner
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed at this hotel, and it won't be the last time either. From check-in to check-out, it is a delight to stay there. The staff are very friendly and even more helpful. The hotel is clean and although not the largest rooms, if you get a room with a balcony they are pleasant enough. The breakfasts are continental, self-service style with a large choice of cereals, meats, cheeses, yoghurt and bread rolls etc. A bonus in the summer is to have your breakfast upstairs on the roof. The location couldn't really be better, two minutes walk from St Mark's Square and five minutes from the lagoon for boats to Murano and the airport. We were there for our Honeymoon and wouldn't have wanted to spend it anywhere else. The Firenze is the place we will always look at first when booking rooms in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great situation”
Reviews.Author: Caro52
Reviews.Content: We can thoroughly recommend this nice clean hotel with friendly staff. Great location - so easy to stroll to San Marco - and beyond. No carpets on floor - very Italian - so if you don't want cold feet remember to take footwear for nipping to the bathroom! Central light had to be seen to be believed - confection of venetian glass. Breakfast continental but plentiful. Directions of how to find it issued by hotel not very accurate - one of the previous reviewers had posted some photos which were very helpful - Even so we still had to ask directions. Name of hotel is written on the pavement at the narrow entrance. Once you've found it - enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location Two Blocks Away From San Marco”
Reviews.Author: simon-fidler
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel is, like all Venetian hotels, overpriced. But, if you're visiting this amazing City the location of the Firenze is perfect. You can see the domes of the church of St Mark and the Campanile di San Marco from the roof top terrace in St Mark's square. San Marco is less than a minute's walk from the hotel. When finding the hotel you need to be looking down at the pavement to spot the only obvious signs to it or look up above the shop fronts (we walked past it twice). The hotel is nothing special and the rooms are quite small (the bath in the 'bathroom' we had was more of a deep shower tray than a bath!) but if you get a room on the fourth floor you have the bonus of a private balcony. The decor is typically Venetian with tacky glass wall lights and pastel coloured painted walls, though the hallways and floors are done in attractive marble and everywhere is reasonably clean. The low point is definitely the breakfast. The fruit juice just isn't, and the coffee is undrinkable. If it doesn't come inclusive, go elsewhere! The staff were friendly and recommended two good restaurants: Vino Vino, which is at Ponte delle Veste (next to La Fenice Opera House) and does good lunches and has an excellent selection of wines, as you would expect with that name. The other was Ristorante Anonimo Veneziano at Calle del Fruttariol (near Teatro 'La Fenice'), which provided an excellent dinner for about 70 euros for two with wine. The owner (or head waiter?) is very welcoming and speaks excellent English. The other tip I'd like to offer is about the three famous, and famously expensive, coffee houses in San Marco - Florian, Lavena and Quadri. We only went in the later two and made the mistake of ordering regular coffees in Quadri, which manages to be wonderfully opulent and shabby simultaneously, as at 8.50 euros it was still just a coffee, albeit quite a good one. At Lavena (Wagner's favourite cafe, apparently) we decided to splurge on a 10.50 euro Cheri Cheri - a coffee with cherry brandy, amaretto, thick, thick cream and black cherries that were also soaked in kirsch, which was an absolute masterpiece and very almost worth the cost. In fact it was so good we had to go back for another the next day! I'd suggest you try any of their speciality coffees as I'm sure they are all equally as good. A word or warning though! If you visit one of these cafes while its orchestra is playing outside (they each have one) you'll be charged another (one-off) 5 - 6 euros on top of your coffee bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Albergo Firenze”
Reviews.Author: mglory44
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this "boutique hotel" which was just steps from St. Mark's Square but on a quiet side street. The hotel personnel were very friendly and were English speaking. The rooms were decorated with Venice glass light fixtures and brightly colored walls and furniture. Our bathroom was a good size. The breakfasts were included and were served in an elegant little dining room with fresh fruit and rolls and pastries. The nicest part was the rooftop terrace which had a view of many church steeples, the Campanile and many other rooftops and antennas, but at sunset it was gorgeous. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie5
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely little hotel & it's only 2 minutes stroll from St Marks Square & the Basillica. I booked the hotel through hotelsupermarket.co.uk & to me it was perfect, the rooms aren't the biggest but you are in Venice and unless you are there on honeymoon you aren't going to be spending a lot of time in there. The views aren't the greatest (see Photos) but all you have to do is go for a walk for great views, my room was a single & had a safe, TV & minibar there was a welcome tray of juice water & biscuit. The bathroom had a bath with very powerful shower heated towel rail complimentry soap etc + "Slippers" - How cool! The Breakfast room is great - very cosy good selection of rolls & pastries with fruit & yoghurts etc & choice of tea, hot chocolate & seriously good coffee. Reception staff are very friendly & helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone & everyone, especially if like me you are a single female traveller lots of places to eat near buy & felt quite safe in most of the lanes around the hotel at night. Please check my photos to see how easy it is to get from the waterbus to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Neat little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benn-m
Reviews.Content: This three star Hotel cost Â£130 per night for a double room for two, with breakfast. The Hotel is a smart little hotel in a very central location. It is spotlessly clean and the staff are pleasant and helpful. The mini bar is cheaper than the local bars and the room we stayed in was small but pleasant although at first we were given a room that had no window and was the size of a cupboard. Breakfast was a dissapointment as there was very little food and what there was left a lot to be desired. Small white rolls and processed cheese ! Also in the picrture it looks like you eat on the roof top terrace but you don't instead you eat in a very small dinning room on the first floor - although it is pleasant enough in its self. Overall not a bad hotel in a good location - so long as you dont mind staying in St Marco !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PostcardSwansea
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location and couldn't have been more pleased - the only downside to being so close to San Marco was that it was sometimes a little noisy in the street outside at night. That said, it wasn't enough to deter me from staying here again. The ferry to / from the airport is no more than a five minute walk away. The whole hotel is small-scale, but our room was spotlessly clean, if tiny. The roof terrace is a great bonus - good for picnic lunches! We would have appreciated a lounge area as there wasn't really anywhere in our room to sit, although the breakfast room was available during the day Make sure you take a map and print off directions as it would be near-enough impossible to find this hotel's entrance without some clue as to what to look for.

Reviews.Title: “Had everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Rostler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for the Water bus from the airport. A lovely, small hotel with helpfull and friendly staff. Our room was on the fourth floor and plenty big enough, with a clean, spacious, well equiped bathroom. Typical and adaquate continental breakfast with fresh bread, fruit and cereal. Directons: Disembark from the waterbus at San Marco and bear left. Turn first right up Valleresso, go to the end and turn left. Go for 20 meters and look for Hotel Firenze embossed on pavment on the right in front of narrow alley way.
